snippet: Alternative for Germany, started by a Hamburg economics professor, could play the role of spoiler in the September elections.
abstract: Alternative for Germany, political party calling for end to European currency union, is gaining strength in final six months before country's parliamentary elections; question remains whether party, started by Hamburg economics professor Bernd Lucke, is experiencing short-lived buzz of political fad or represents beginning of significant movement that could jeopardize struggling euro.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and MELISSA EDDY

lead_paragraph: Alternative for Germany, started by a Hamburg economics professor, could play the role of spoiler in the September elections.

headline.seo: Elites Flock to Anti-Euro Party, Alternative for Germany
headline.main: German Elites Drawn to Anti-Euro Party, Spelling Trouble for Merkel
headline.print_headline: German Elites Drawn to Anti-Euro Party, Spelling Trouble for Merkel
